providers.heading: AI providers
providers.ollamaEnableDesc: Use a local Ollama instance for AI inference.
providers.ollamaUrlDesc: Base URL of your Ollama server.
providers.openrouterEnableDesc: Use OpenRouter to access multiple AI models via a single API key.
providers.openrouterApiKeyDesc: Your OpenRouter API key. Stored locally in the plugin data.
providers.defaultProviderDesc: Provider used when an agent does not specify one.

general.heading: General
general.agentsFolderDesc: Path relative to vault root where agent definitions are stored.
general.userNameDesc: Your name, available as {{user_name}} in agent prompts.
general.createDefaultAgentDesc: Generate a fully-featured, ready-to-use Obsidian Copilot agent in the agents folder.
general.generateMockDataDesc: Scaffolds an Inbox, Projects, and Daily Notes folder with sample files to test advanced agents.

behaviour.heading: Behaviour
behaviour.defaultModelDesc: Model identifier used when an agent does not specify one (e.g. llama3, mistral).
behaviour.maxHistoryDesc: Number of messages to keep in the conversation context.
behaviour.autoSaveDesc: Seconds between automatic log saves (0 to disable).
behaviour.confirmDestructiveDesc: Show a confirmation modal before agents write, move, or delete files.
behaviour.maxFileOpsDesc: Rate limit: maximum file operations an agent can perform per message.

interface.heading: Interface
interface.chatPositionDesc: Where the chat panel opens in the workspace.
interface.showStatusBarDesc: Display active agent info in the status bar.
interface.showTokenCountDesc: Display token usage in the status bar.

chat.title: AI agents
chat.selectAgentPrompt: Select an agent to start chatting.
chat.errorRender: Error rendering message. Showing raw text:

agentSelector.createNewAgentDesc: Click here to build a new AI agent.

editor.folderIdDesc: The unique folder name for this agent (lowercase, no spaces).
editor.name: Name
editor.nameDesc: The display name of the agent.
editor.descriptionDesc: A short description of what this agent does.
editor.author: Author
editor.enabledDesc: If disabled, the agent won't show up in the selector.
editor.sourcesDesc: Paths to include in the knowledge context.
editor.writePermissionsDesc: Paths this agent can write to.
editor.createPermissionsDesc: Paths this agent can create files in.
editor.vaultRootAccessDesc: Allow access beyond the specified folders.
editor.confirmDestructiveDesc: Require user confirmation for write, move, delete operations.
editor.enableMemoryDesc: If enabled, the agent will load previous chat sessions to maintain long-term context.
editor.systemPromptDesc: The main instructions for this agent. Supports variables like {{user_name}}, {{date}}, etc.

permission.title: Agent permission request
permission.confirmQuestion: Do you want to allow this operation?

notices.mockDataExists: Mock data folders and files already exist.
notices.modelRequired: Model is required and must be provided either in the agent frontmatter or in the plugin settings
notices.modelNoTools: The selected AI model does not support tools. Please change the model in the agent settings (e.g., to llama3.1 or qwen2.5-coder).
notices.aiAgentErrorNoTools: The selected AI model does not support tools. Please change the model in the agent settings (e.g., to llama3.1 or qwen2.5-coder).

templateEngine.readDenied: [READ denied: {path} is not in read or sources]

exampleAgent.name: Obsidian Copilot
exampleAgent.description: An advanced, fully-featured AI assistant capable of managing notes, summarizing content, and organizing your vault.
exampleAgent.author: AI Agents
exampleAgent.promptBody:
You are **{{agent_name}}**, an advanced AI assistant embedded directly within the user's Obsidian vault.
Your goal is to help the user manage their personal knowledge base, summarize notes, brainstorm ideas, and write content.

## Context
- **User:** {{user_name}}
- **Current Date:** {{date}}

## Guidelines
1. **Be Concise & Markdown-Native:** Always format your responses using rich Markdown (headers, lists, bold, italics, code blocks) to make them look beautiful in Obsidian.
2. **Leverage Memory:** You have the `memory` flag enabled, which means you have access to the context of previous chats. Refer back to past conversations if it helps answer the current query.
3. **Drafting Notes:** When asked to write a note, provide a clear, well-structured output.
4. **Tools & Operations:** When proposing changes to files or creating new notes, clearly explain what you are going to do.

How can I assist you with your vault today?

basicAgent.name: Basic Assistant
basicAgent.promptBody:
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Respond concisely.
